title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox infielder Marcelo Mayer practiced at second base, while Caleb Durbin worked out at third base during spring training.
Manager Alex Cora plans to evaluate Mayer and Durbin at both 2B and 3B to determine the starting lineup.
Boston aims to improve defense, having led MLB in errors in 2025, with Mayer and Durbin key to solidifying infield.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots quarterbacks coach Ashton Grant will not pursue NFL offensive coordinator openings, choosing to stay in New England.
Grant, a Manchester, Conn. native, played a key role in Drake Maye's development during his second season with the Patriots.
Grant's coaching continuity is expected in the upcoming season, alongside Mike Vrabel and Josh McDaniels for the Patriots.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A burst pipe flooded Matt's Barber Shop in Brighton, causing significant damage to the property and its contents.
Customer Dietrich Warner launched a GoFundMe, raising over $25,800 for the shop's recovery by February 13, 2026.
The Brighton community's fundraising efforts aim to help reopen the shop quickly, with cleanup and repairs underway.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity,' a romcom with Elizabeth Olsen, is now available on Apple TV.
'Harold & Maude' starring Bud Cort is streaming on Pluto TV following Cort's passing.
Season 10 of 'Love Is Blind' is available on Netflix for Valentine's Day viewing.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Judge rules that books on gender stereotypes are not part of a lawsuit involving LGBTQ-friendly lessons in Lexington.
Lexington father Alan L. sued the school district, citing religious objections to LGBTQ-related classroom materials for his son.
The judge determined books 'Pink Is For Boys' and 'Except When They Don't' challenge stereotypes, not gender identity.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, from the Boston Red Sox, may join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic pending a physical.
Anthony would replace Corbin Carroll, who fractured his hand, and would be Team USA's youngest player at 21.
Garrett Whitlock is the only other Red Sox player on Team USA's roster for the World Baseball Classic.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: A $20 million penthouse at Ocean House in Westerly, Rhode Island, is on the market.
The 4,696-square-foot unit includes three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and a 2,400-square-foot private terrace.
The penthouse offers access to the hotel's amenities like a private beach, gym, and dining options.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are 35-19 and rank second in the Eastern Conference entering the All-Star break.
Boston ranks third in offensive rating and second in defensive rating, crucial for championship contenders.
Celtics have a 12-14 record in clutch games, the worst among current playoff teams.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter visitors activities from museums to outdoor adventures across its 15 towns, highlighting local culture and history.
Outdoor activities include beach walks, snowshoeing, and exploring the Cape Cod Rail Trail and Nickerson State Park.
Visitors can enjoy local dining, craft breweries, and cultural events, including theater performances and wine tastings.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, a 30-year-old from North Carolina, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon for Breakthrough T1D.
Lapczynski, a Type 1 Diabetes patient, managed diabetic ketoacidosis while in college in Boston.
She aims to inspire others with T1D, including her mother and patients, by participating in the marathon.
